intro: Amauropelta andicola, commonly known as the Andean shield fern, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are evergreen and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. Amauropelta andicola is adapted to cold, dry environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
